AgentConfig.description:
Configuration for a single agent in the system.

Defines an agent's complete configuration including its model, environment,
capabilities, and behavior settings. Each agent can have its own:
- Language model configuration
- Environment setup (tools and resources)
- Response type definitions
- System prompts and default user prompts
- Role-based capabilities

The configuration can be loaded from YAML or created programmatically.

name.description: Name of the agent
name.title: Name

inherits.description: Name of agent config to inherit from
inherits.title: Inherits

description.description: Optional description of the agent's purpose
description.title: Description

model.description:
The model to use for this agent. Can be either a simple model name
string (e.g. 'openai:gpt-4') or a structured model definition.
model.title: Model

mcp_servers.description:
List of MCP server configurations:
- str entries are converted to StdioMCPServer
- MCPServerConfig for full server configuration
mcp_servers.title: Mcp Servers

result_type.description: Name of the response definition to use
result_type.title: Result Type

retries.description: Number of retries for failed operations (maps to pydantic-ai's retries)
retries.title: Retries

result_tool_name.description: Name of the tool used for structured responses
result_tool_name.title: Result Tool Name

result_tool_description.description: Custom description for the result tool
result_tool_description.title: Result Tool Description

end_strategy.description: The strategy for handling multiple tool calls when a final result is found
end_strategy.title: End Strategy

avatar.description: URL or path to agent's avatar image
avatar.title: Avatar

library_system_prompts.description: System prompts for the agent from the library
library_system_prompts.title: Library System Prompts

user_prompts.description: Default user prompts for the agent
user_prompts.title: User Prompts

model_settings.description: Additional settings to pass to the model
model_settings.title: Model Settings

config_file_path.description: Config file path for resolving environment.
config_file_path.title: Config File Path

triggers.description: Event sources that activate this agent
triggers.title: Triggers

workers.description: Worker agents which will be available as tools.
workers.title: Workers

debug.description: Enable debug output for this agent.
debug.title: Debug

AgentConfig.title: AgentConfig

AgentConnectionConfig.description:
Forward messages to another agent.

This configuration defines how messages should flow from one agent to another,
including:
- Basic routing (which agent, what type of connection)
- Message queueing and processing strategies
- Timing controls (priority, delay)
- Execution behavior (wait for completion)

wait_for_completion.description:
Whether to wait for the result before continuing.

If True, message processing will wait for the target to complete.
If False, message will be forwarded asynchronously.
wait_for_completion.title: Wait For Completion

queued.description: Whether messages should be queued for manual processing.
queued.title: Queued

priority.description: Priority of the task. Lower = higher priority.
priority.title: Priority

exit_condition.description: When to exit the application (by raising SystemExit).
exit_condition.title: Exit Condition

transform.description: Optional function to transform messages before forwarding.
transform.title: Transform

name.description: Name of target agent.
name.title: Name

connection_type.description:
How messages should be handled by the target agent:
- run: Execute message as a new run
- context: Add message to agent's context
- forward: Forward message to agent's outbox
connection_type.title: Connection Type

AgentConnectionConfig.title: AgentConnectionConfig

AndCondition.description: Require all conditions to be met.
AndCondition.title: AndCondition

name.description: Technical identifier (automatically set from config key during registration).
name.title: Name

description.description: Human-readable description of what this prompt does.
description.title: Description

arguments.description: List of arguments that this prompt accepts.
arguments.title: Arguments

metadata.description: Additional metadata for storing custom prompt information.
metadata.title: Metadata

type.description: Discriminator field identifying this as a CLI-based resource.
type.title: Type

uri.description: Canonical URI for this resource, set during registration if unset.
uri.title: Uri

processors.description: Processing steps to apply when loading this resource.
processors.title: Processors

watch.description: Configuration for file system watching, if supported.

name.description: Technical identifier (automatically set from config key during registration).
name.title: Name

command.description: Command to execute (string or sequence of arguments).
command.title: Command

shell.description: Whether to run the command through a shell.
shell.title: Shell

timeout.description: Maximum time in seconds to wait for command completion.
timeout.title: Timeout

predicate.description:
Function to evaluate condition:
Args:
    message: Current message being processed
    stats: Current connection statistics
Returns:
    Whether condition is met
predicate.title: Predicate

CallableConnectionConfig.description:
Forward messages to a callable.

The callable can be either sync or async and should have the signature:
def process_message(message: ChatMessage[Any], **kwargs) -> Any

Any additional kwargs specified in the config will be passed to the callable.

wait_for_completion.description:
Whether to wait for the result before continuing.

If True, message processing will wait for the target to complete.
If False, message will be forwarded asynchronously.
wait_for_completion.title: Wait For Completion

queued.description: Whether messages should be queued for manual processing.
queued.title: Queued

priority.description: Priority of the task. Lower = higher priority.
priority.title: Priority

exit_condition.description: When to exit the application (by raising SystemExit).
exit_condition.title: Exit Condition

transform.description: Optional function to transform messages before forwarding.
transform.title: Transform

callable.description: Import path to the message processing function.
callable.title: Callable

kw_args.description: Additional kwargs to pass to the callable.
kw_args.title: Kw Args

CallableConnectionConfig.title: CallableConnectionConfig

CallableResource.description: Resource from executing a Python callable.

type.description: Discriminator field identifying this as a callable-based resource.
type.title: Type

uri.description: Canonical URI for this resource, set during registration if unset.
uri.title: Uri

processors.description: Processing steps to apply when loading this resource.
processors.title: Processors

watch.description: Configuration for file system watching, if supported.

name.description: Technical identifier (automatically set from config key during registration).
name.title: Name

import_path.description: Dotted import path to the callable to execute.
import_path.title: Import Path

keyword_args.description: Keyword arguments to pass to the callable.
keyword_args.title: Keyword Args

CallableResource.title: CallableResource

CallbackProviderConfig.description:
Configuration for callback-based provider.

Allows defining processor functions through:
- Import path to callback function
- Generic type for result validation

name.description: Optional name for the provider instance.
name.title: Name

CallbackProviderConfig.title: CallbackProviderConfig

Capabilities.description: Defines what operations an agent is allowed to perform.

can_list_agents.description: Whether the agent can discover other available agents.
can_list_agents.title: Can List Agents

can_delegate_tasks.description: Whether the agent can delegate tasks to other agents.
can_delegate_tasks.title: Can Delegate Tasks

can_observe_agents.description: Whether the agent can monitor other agents' activities.
can_observe_agents.title: Can Observe Agents

history_access.description: Level of access to conversation history.
history_access.title: History Access

stats_access.description: Level of access to usage statistics.
stats_access.title: Stats Access

can_load_resources.description: Whether the agent can load and access resource content.
can_load_resources.title: Can Load Resources

can_list_resources.description: Whether the agent can discover available resources.
can_list_resources.title: Can List Resources

can_register_tools.description: Whether the agent can register importable functions as tools.
can_register_tools.title: Can Register Tools

can_register_code.description: Whether the agent can create new tools from provided code.
can_register_code.title: Can Register Code

can_install_packages.description: Whether the agent can install Python packages for tools.
can_install_packages.title: Can Install Packages

can_chain_tools.description: Whether the agent can chain multiple tool calls into one.
can_chain_tools.title: Can Chain Tools

can_execute_code.description: Whether the agent can execute Python code (WARNING: No sandbox).
can_execute_code.title: Can Execute Code

can_execute_commands.description: Whether the agent can execute CLI commands (use at your own risk).
can_execute_commands.title: Can Execute Commands

can_create_workers.description: Whether the agent can create worker agents (as tools).
can_create_workers.title: Can Create Workers

can_create_delegates.description: Whether the agent can spawn temporary delegate agents.
can_create_delegates.title: Can Create Delegates

can_add_agents.description: Whether the agent can add aother agents to the pool.
can_add_agents.title: Can Add Agents

can_ask_agents.description: Whether the agent can ask other agents of the pool.
can_ask_agents.title: Can Ask Agents

Capabilities.title: Capabilities

ConnectionCondition.description: Base class for connection control conditions.
ConnectionCondition.title: ConnectionCondition

CostLimitCondition.description: Disconnect when cost limit is reached.

max_cost.description: Maximum cost in USD before triggering.
max_cost.title: Max Cost

CostLimitCondition.title: CostLimitCondition

CostOptimizedMultiModel.description: Multi-model that selects based on cost and token limits.

max_input_cost.description: Maximum allowed cost in USD per request
max_input_cost.title: Max Input Cost

CostOptimizedMultiModel.title: CostOptimizedMultiModel

namespace.description: Optional namespace prefix for tool names
namespace.title: Namespace

type.description: Discriminator field identifying this as a custom toolset.
type.title: Type

import_path.description: Dotted import path to the custom toolset implementation class.
import_path.title: Import Path

DelegationMultiModel.description:
Meta-model that dynamically selects models based on a user prompt.

Example YAML configuration:
    ```yaml
    model:
      type: delegation
      selector_model: openai:gpt-4-turbo
      models:
        - openai:gpt-4
        - openai:gpt-3.5-turbo
      selection_prompt: |
        Pick gpt-4 for complex tasks, gpt-3.5-turbo for simple queries.
    ```

selection_prompt.description: Instructions for model selection based on task type.
selection_prompt.title: Selection Prompt

DelegationMultiModel.title: DelegationMultiModel

name.description: Technical identifier (automatically set from config key during registration).
name.title: Name

description.description: Human-readable description of what this prompt does.
description.title: Description

arguments.description: List of arguments that this prompt accepts.
arguments.title: Arguments

metadata.description: Additional metadata for storing custom prompt information.
metadata.title: Metadata

import_path.description: Dotted import path to the callable that generates the prompt.
import_path.title: Import Path

template.description: Optional template string for formatting the callable's output.
template.title: Template

completions.description: Optional mapping of argument names to completion functions.
completions.title: Completions

type.description: Discriminator field identifying this as a function-based prompt.
type.title: Type

EmailConfig.description:
Email event source configuration.

Monitors an email inbox for new messages and converts them to events.

name.description: Unique identifier for this event source.
name.title: Name

enabled.description: Whether this event source is active.
enabled.title: Enabled

template.title: Template

port.description: Server port (defaults to 993 for IMAP SSL)
port.title: Port

mark_seen.description: Whether to mark processed emails as seen
mark_seen.title: Mark Seen

EmailConfig.title: EmailConfig

namespace.description: Optional namespace prefix for tool names
namespace.title: Namespace

type.description: Discriminator field identifying this as an entry point toolset.
type.title: Type

FallbackMultiModel.description:
Tries models in sequence until one succeeds.

Example YAML configuration:
    ```yaml
    model:
      type: fallback
      models:
        - openai:gpt-4  # Try this first
        - openai:gpt-3.5-turbo  # Fall back to this if gpt-4 fails
        - ollama:llama2  # Last resort
    ```
FallbackMultiModel.title: FallbackMultiModel

FileConnectionConfig.description:
Write messages to a file using a template.

The template receives the full message object for formatting.
Available fields include:
- timestamp: When the message was created
- name: Name of the sender
- content: Message content
- role: Message role (user/assistant/system)
- model: Model used (if any)
- cost_info: Token usage and cost info
- forwarded_from: Chain of message forwarding

wait_for_completion.description:
Whether to wait for the result before continuing.

If True, message processing will wait for the target to complete.
If False, message will be forwarded asynchronously.
wait_for_completion.title: Wait For Completion

queued.description: Whether messages should be queued for manual processing.
queued.title: Queued

priority.description: Priority of the task. Lower = higher priority.
priority.title: Priority

exit_condition.description: When to exit the application (by raising SystemExit).
exit_condition.title: Exit Condition

transform.description: Optional function to transform messages before forwarding.
transform.title: Transform

path.description: Path to output file. Supports variables: {date}, {time}, {agent}
path.title: Path

template.title: Template

FileConnectionConfig.title: FileConnectionConfig

FileEnvironment.description:
File-based environment configuration.

Loads environment settings from external YAML files, supporting:
- Reusable environment configurations
- Separation of concerns
- Environment sharing between agents
- Version control of environment settings
FileEnvironment.title: FileEnvironment

FilePrompt.description:
Prompt loaded from a file.

This type of prompt loads its content from a file, allowing for longer or more
complex prompts to be managed in separate files. The file content is loaded
and parsed according to the specified format.

name.description: Technical identifier (automatically set from config key during registration).
name.title: Name

description.description: Human-readable description of what this prompt does.
description.title: Description

arguments.description: List of arguments that this prompt accepts.
arguments.title: Arguments

metadata.description: Additional metadata for storing custom prompt information.
metadata.title: Metadata

path.description: Path to the file containing the prompt content.
path.title: Path

format.description: Format of the file content (text, markdown, or jinja2 template).
format.title: Format

type.description: Discriminator field identifying this as a file-based prompt.
type.title: Type

watch.description: Whether to watch the file for changes and reload automatically.
watch.title: Watch

FilePrompt.title: FilePrompt

agents.description: Optional set of agent names to include. If None, logs all agents.
agents.title: Agents

path.description: Path to storage file (extension determines format unless specified)
path.title: Path

FileWatchConfig.description:
File watching event source.

Monitors file system changes and triggers agent actions when:
- Files are created
- Files are modified
- Files are deleted

type.description: Type discriminator for file watch sources.
type.title: Type

name.description: Unique identifier for this event source.
name.title: Name

enabled.description: Whether this event source is active.
enabled.title: Enabled

template.title: Template

paths.description: Paths or patterns to watch for changes.
paths.title: Paths

FileWatchConfig.title: FileWatchConfig

GlobalSettings.description: Global settings that apply to all components.

timeout.description: Maximum time in seconds to wait for operations
timeout.title: Timeout

max_retries.description: Maximum number of retries for failed operations
max_retries.title: Max Retries

requirements.description: List of package requirments for the functions used in this file.

pip_index_url.description: Alternative PyPI index URL for package installation
pip_index_url.title: Pip Index Url

scripts.description: PEP723 scripts (can be imported and will be scanned for dependencies)
scripts.title: Scripts

prefer_uv.description: Explicitely use uv for package installation / management
prefer_uv.title: Prefer Uv

llm_capabilities.description: Control which system capabilities are exposed to LLMs.

HumanProviderConfig.description:
Configuration for human-in-the-loop provider.

This provider enables direct human interaction for responses and decisions.
Useful for testing, training, and oversight of agent operations.

name.description: Optional name for the provider instance.
name.title: Name

timeout.description: Timeout in seconds for human response. None means wait indefinitely.
timeout.title: Timeout

show_context.description: Whether to show conversation context to human.
show_context.title: Show Context

HumanProviderConfig.title: HumanProviderConfig

ImportModel.description:
Model that imports and delegates to other models.

Useful to allow using "external" models via YAML in LLMling-Agent

model.description: Model class to import and use.
model.title: Model

kw_args.description: Keyword arguments for the imported model class.
kw_args.title: Kw Args

ImportModel.title: ImportModel

ImportedResponseDefinition.description:
Response definition that imports an existing Pydantic model.

Allows using externally defined Pydantic models as response types.
Benefits:
- Reuse existing model definitions
- Full Python type support
- Complex validation logic
- IDE support for imported types

Example:
    responses:
      AnalysisResult:
        type: import
        import_path: myapp.models.AnalysisResult

description.description: A description for this response definition.
description.title: Description

result_tool_name.description: The tool name for the Agent tool to create the structured response.
result_tool_name.title: Result Tool Name

result_tool_description.description: The tool description for the Agent tool to create the structured response.
result_tool_description.title: Result Tool Description

result_retries.description: Retry override. How often the Agent should try to validate the response.
result_retries.title: Result Retries

import_path.description: The path to the pydantic model to use as the response type.
import_path.title: Import Path

ImportedResponseDefinition.title: ImportedResponseDefinition

InlineEnvironment.description:
Direct environment configuration without external files.

Allows embedding complete environment settings directly in the agent
configuration instead of referencing external files. Useful for:
- Self-contained configurations
- Testing and development
- Simple agent setups

version.description: Version string for this configuration format.
version.title: Version

context_processors.description: Content processors available for resource transformation.
context_processors.title: Context Processors

resource_groups.description: Groups of resources for logical organization.
resource_groups.title: Resource Groups

toolsets.description: Toolset configurations for extensible tool collections.
toolsets.title: Toolsets

config_file_path.description: Path to agent config file for resolving relative paths
config_file_path.title: Config File Path

InlineEnvironment.title: InlineEnvironment

InlineResponseDefinition.description:
Inline definition of an agent's response structure.

Allows defining response types directly in the configuration using:
- Field definitions with types and descriptions
- Optional validation constraints
- Custom field descriptions

Example:
    responses:
      BasicResult:
        type: inline
        fields:
          success: {type: bool, description: "Operation success"}
          message: {type: str, description: "Result details"}

description.description: A description for this response definition.
description.title: Description

result_tool_name.description: The tool name for the Agent tool to create the structured response.
result_tool_name.title: Result Tool Name

result_tool_description.description: The tool description for the Agent tool to create the structured response.
result_tool_description.title: Result Tool Description

result_retries.description: Retry override. How often the Agent should try to validate the response.
result_retries.title: Result Retries

InlineResponseDefinition.title: InlineResponseDefinition

InputModel.description: Model that delegates responses to human input.

prompt_template.description: Template for showing the prompt to the human.
prompt_template.title: Prompt Template

show_system.description: Whether to show system messages to the human.
show_system.title: Show System

input_prompt.description: Prompt to show when requesting input.
input_prompt.title: Input Prompt

InputModel.title: InputModel

block_start_string.description: String denoting the beginning of a block (default: '{%').
block_start_string.title: Block Start String

block_end_string.description: String denoting the end of a block (default: '%}').
block_end_string.title: Block End String

variable_start_string.description: String denoting the beginning of a variable (default: '{{').
variable_start_string.title: Variable Start String

variable_end_string.description: String denoting the end of a variable (default: '}}').
variable_end_string.title: Variable End String

comment_start_string.description: String denoting the beginning of a comment (default: '{#').
comment_start_string.title: Comment Start String

comment_end_string.description: String denoting the end of a comment (default: '#}').
comment_end_string.title: Comment End String

line_statement_prefix.description: Prefix that begins a line-based statement (e.g., '#' for line statements).
line_statement_prefix.title: Line Statement Prefix

line_comment_prefix.description: Prefix that begins a line-based comment.
line_comment_prefix.title: Line Comment Prefix

trim_blocks.description: Remove first newline after a block (affects whitespace control).
trim_blocks.title: Trim Blocks

lstrip_blocks.description: Remove leading spaces and tabs from the start of a line to a block.
lstrip_blocks.title: Lstrip Blocks

keep_trailing_newline.description: Preserve the trailing newline when rendering templates.
keep_trailing_newline.title: Keep Trailing Newline

extensions.description: List of Jinja2 extensions to load (e.g., 'jinja2.ext.do').
extensions.title: Extensions

undefined.description: Behavior when accessing undefined variables (default, strict, debug, chainable).
undefined.title: Undefined

filters.description: Custom filters as mapping of names to import paths.
filters.title: Filters

tests.description: Custom tests as mapping of names to import paths.
tests.title: Tests

globals.description: Global variables available to all templates.
globals.title: Globals

Job.description:
A task is a piece of work that can be executed by an agent.

Requirements:
- The agent must have compatible dependencies (required_dependency)
- The agent must produce the specified result type (required_return_type)

Equipment:
- The task provides necessary tools for execution (tools)
- Tools are temporarily available during task execution

name.description: Technical identifier (automatically set from config key during registration)
name.title: Name

description.description: Human-readable description of what this task does
description.title: Description

required_return_type.description: Expected type of the task result.
required_return_type.title: Required Return Type

required_dependency.description: Dependencies or context data needed for task execution
required_dependency.title: Required Dependency

knowledge.description:
Optional knowledge sources for this task:
- Simple file/URL paths
- Rich resource definitions
- Prompt templates

min_context_tokens.description: Minimum amount of required context size.
min_context_tokens.title: Min Context Tokens

Job.title: Job

Knowledge.description:
Collection of context sources for an agent.

Supports both simple paths and rich resource types for content loading,
plus LLMling's prompt system for dynamic content generation.

paths.description: Quick access to files and URLs.
paths.title: Paths

resources.description:
Rich resource definitions supporting:
- PathResource: Complex file patterns, watching
- TextResource: Raw content
- CLIResource: Command output
- RepositoryResource: Git repos
- SourceResource: Python source
- CallableResource: Function results
resources.title: Resources

prompts.description:
Prompts for dynamic content generation:
- StaticPrompt: Fixed message templates
- DynamicPrompt: Python function-based
- FilePrompt: File-based with template support
prompts.title: Prompts

convert_to_markdown.description: Whether to convert content to markdown when possible.
convert_to_markdown.title: Convert To Markdown

Knowledge.title: Knowledge

load_resource.description: Whether the LLM can load and access resource content.
load_resource.title: Load Resource

get_resources.description: Whether the LLM can discover available resources.
get_resources.title: Get Resources

install_package.description: Whether the LLM can install new Python packages for future tools.
install_package.title: Install Package

register_tool.description: Whether the LLM can register importable functions as new tools.
register_tool.title: Register Tool

register_code_tool.description: Whether the LLM can create new tools from provided Python code.
register_code_tool.title: Register Code Tool

chain_tools.description: Whether the LLM gains capability to chain multiple tool calls into one.
chain_tools.title: Chain Tools

LiteLLMProviderConfig.description:
Configuration for LiteLLM-based provider.

This provider uses LiteLLM for handling model interactions, tool calls,
and structured outputs. It provides fine-grained control over model behavior
and validation.

model.description: Optional model name to use. If not specified, uses default model.

model_settings.description: Additional model-specific settings passed to PydanticAI.
model_settings.title: Model Settings

agents.title: Agents

count_mode.description:
How to count messages:
- total: All messages in conversation
- per_agent: Messages from each agent separately
count_mode.title: Count Mode

base_url.description: Optional base URL for API requests, overrides the one in spec.

OrCondition.description: Require any condition to be met.

processors.description: Processing steps to apply when loading this resource.

name.description: Technical identifier (automatically set from config key during registration).

system_prompts.description: Mapping of system prompt identifiers to their definitions.
system_prompts.title: System Prompts

template.description:
Optional template for combining prompts.
Has access to prompts grouped by type.
template.title: Template

PromptMessage.description: A message in a prompt template.
PromptMessage.title: PromptMessage

name.description: Name of the argument as used in the prompt.
name.title: Name

required.description: Whether this argument must be provided when formatting the prompt.
required.title: Required

type_hint.description: Type annotation for the argument, defaults to str.

default.description: Default value if argument is optional.
default.title: Default

completion_function.description: Optional function to provide argument completions.
completion_function.title: Completion Function

PydanticAIProviderConfig.description:
Configuration for PydanticAI-based provider.

This provider uses PydanticAI for handling model interactions, tool calls,
and structured outputs. It provides fine-grained control over model behavior
and validation.

name.description: Optional name for the provider instance.
name.title: Name

end_strategy.description:
How to handle tool calls when final result found:
- early: Stop when valid result found
- complete: Run all requested tools
- confirm: Ask user what to do
end_strategy.title: End Strategy

model.description: Optional model name to use. If not specified, uses default model.
model.title: Model

result_retries.description:
Maximum retries for result validation.
None means use the global retry setting.
result_retries.title: Result Retries

defer_model_check.description:
Whether to defer model evaluation until first run.
True can speed up initialization but might fail later.
defer_model_check.title: Defer Model Check

model_settings.description: Additional model-specific settings passed to PydanticAI.
model_settings.title: Model Settings

validation_enabled.description: Whether to validate model outputs against schemas.
validation_enabled.title: Validation Enabled

allow_text_fallback.description: Whether to accept plain text when structured output fails.
allow_text_fallback.title: Allow Text Fallback

PydanticAIProviderConfig.title: PydanticAIProviderConfig

RemoteInputModel.description:
Model that connects to a remote human operator.

Example YAML configuration:
    ```yaml
    models:
      remote-human:
        type: remote-input
        url: ws://localhost:8000/v1/chat/stream  # or http://localhost:8000/v1/chat
        api_key: your-api-key
    ```

url.description: URL of the remote input server.
url.title: Url

RemoteInputModel.title: RemoteInputModel

RemoteProxyModel.description:
Model that proxies requests to a remote model server.

Example YAML configuration:
    ```yaml
    models:
      remote-gpt4:
        type: remote-proxy
        url: ws://model-server:8000/v1/completion  # or http://
        api_key: your-api-key
    ```

url.description: URL of the remote model server.
url.title: Url

RemoteProxyModel.title: RemoteProxyModel

ResponseField.description:
Field definition for inline response types.

Defines a single field in an inline response definition, including:
- Data type specification
- Optional description
- Validation constraints

Used by InlineResponseDefinition to structure response fields.

type.description: Data type of the response field
type.title: Type

description.description: Optional description of what this field represents
description.title: Description

constraints.description: Optional validation constraints for the field
constraints.title: Constraints

SSEMCPServer.description:
MCP server using Server-Sent Events transport.

Connects to a server over HTTP with SSE for real-time communication.

TokenOptimizedMultiModel.description:
Multi-model that selects based on input token count.

Example YAML configuration:
    ```yaml
    model:
      type: token-optimized
      models:
        - openai:gpt-4  # 8k context
        - openai:gpt-4-32k  # 32k context
        - openai:gpt-3.5-turbo-16k  # 16k context
      strategy: efficient  # Use smallest sufficient context window
    ```
TokenOptimizedMultiModel.title: TokenOptimizedMultiModel

What tokens to count:
- total: All tokens used
- prompt: Only prompt tokens
- completion: Only completion tokens

WebhookConfig.description:
Webhook event source.

Listens for HTTP requests and triggers agent actions when:
- POST requests are received at the configured endpoint
- Request content matches any defined filters

enabled.description: Whether this event source is active.
enabled.title: Enabled

template.title: Template

WordMatchCondition.description: Disconnect when word/phrase is found in message.

words.description: Words or phrases to match in messages.
words.title: Words

mode.description:
Match mode:
- any: Trigger if any word matches
- all: Require all words to match
mode.title: Mode

WordMatchCondition.title: WordMatchCondition

WorkerConfig.description:
Configuration for a worker agent.

Worker agents are agents that are registered as tools with a parent agent.
This allows building hierarchies and specializations of agents.

name.description: Name of the agent to use as a worker
name.title: Name

reset_history_on_run.description:
Whether to clear worker's conversation history before each run.
True (default): Fresh conversation each time
False: Maintain conversation context between runs
reset_history_on_run.title: Reset History On Run

pass_message_history.description:
Whether to pass parent agent's message history to worker.
True: Worker sees parent's conversation context
False (default): Worker only sees current request
pass_message_history.title: Pass Message History

share_context.description:
Whether to share parent agent's context/dependencies with worker.
True: Worker has access to parent's context data
False (default): Worker uses own isolated context
share_context.title: Share Context

WorkerConfig.title: WorkerConfig

description:
Complete agent configuration manifest defining all available agents.

This is the root configuration that:
- Defines available response types (both inline and imported)
- Configures all agent instances and their settings
- Sets up custom role definitions and capabilities
- Manages environment configurations

A single manifest can define multiple agents that can work independently
or collaborate through the orchestrator.

agents.description: Mapping of agent IDs to their configurations
agents.title: Agents

responses.description: Mapping of response names to their definitions
responses.title: Responses

jobs.description: Pre-defined jobs, ready to be used by agents.
jobs.title: Jobs

mcp_servers.description:
List of MCP server configurations:
- str entries are converted to StdioMCPServer
- MCPServerConfig for full server configuration
mcp_servers.title: Mcp Servers

title: AgentsManifest
